newsArray.title: Ishan KishanтАЩs Co-Incidental Response to Aakash ChopraтАЩs тАШYouтАЩre Not DhoniтАЩ Comment During IND vs WI ODI Series 2023 Goes Viral (Watch Video)
newsArray.description: Ishan Kishan was named Player of the Series for his three half-centuries in all three ODIs. The video of this moment has gone viral on social media after Aakash Chopra himself shared it, writing, "We love you Ishan."
newsArray.content: Ishan Kishan's co-incidental response to Aakash Chopra has gone viral after the former cricketer-turned-commentator said that the youngster was not Dhoni. This happened during the recently concluded ODI series between India and West Indies during which Kishan, keeping wickets, had appealed for a stumping. The batter's feet was firmly grounded and Chopra on air, said, "It's very rare that you review the stumping and run out dismissal. So far, I am seeing the feet on the ground. You can come from Ranchi, but your name is not MS Dhoni." Co-incidentally, Kishan was heard saying, ' Ha, fir thik hai ," on the stump mic. Chopra who later shared the video, then went on to say, "We love you Ishan." Ravichandran Ashwin Defends Team Management's Decision to Rest Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma During India vs West Indies ODI Series 2023 . Watch Video Here We love you, Ishan ЁЯдЧ @JioCinema #WIvsIND #CricketTwitter pic.twitter.com/UnzHz1pth1 тАФ Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) August 1, 2023 (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. newsArray.content: IND vs WI 1st T20 2023: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдиреЗ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрд╡рд┐рд░реБрджреНрдзрдЪреА рддреАрди рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ 2-1 рдиреЗ рдЬрд┐рдВрдХрд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рд╡реЗрд│реА, рдЖрддрд╛ рджреЛрдиреНрд╣реА рд╕рдВрдШ рдЯреА-20 рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрдд рдПрдХрдореЗрдХрд╛рдВрд╢реА рднрд┐рдбрдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗрдд. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рддреАрд▓ 3 рдЯреА-20 рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреА рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЖрдЬрдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рдореНрд╣рдгрдЬреЗрдЪ 3 рдСрдЧрд╕реНрдЯрдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рдЦреЗрд│рд╡рд▓реА рдЬрд╛рдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪреА рдХрдорд╛рди рдЕрдиреБрднрд╡реА рдЕрд╖реНрдЯрдкреИрд▓реВ рдЦреЗрд│рд╛рдбреВ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрд╛рдВрдбреНрдпрд╛рдХрдбреЗ (Hardik Pandya) рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдирд┐рдпрдорд┐рдд рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░ рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ (Rohit Sharma) рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╕реНрдЯрд╛рд░ рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬ рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реАрд▓рд╛ (Virat Kohli) рд╡рд┐рд╢реНрд░рд╛рдВрддреА рджреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЖрд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ. (рд╣реЗ рджреЗрдЦреАрд▓ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╛: IND vs WI 1st T20 2023: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЛрдард╛ рдкрд░рд╛рдХреНрд░рдо рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рдареА рд╕рдЬреНрдЬ, рдЖрдЬрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рджреНрд╡рд╛рд░реЗ рдЯреА-20 рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдордзреАрд▓ рдПрдХ рдЦрд╛рд╕ рджреНрд╡рд┐рд╢рддрдХ рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд░ рдкреВрд░реНрдг ) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬрдЪрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШ рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рд╡рд╛рдИрдЯ рджреМрд▒реНрдпрд╛рддреВрди рдЬрд╛рдд рдЖрд╣реЗ рдкрдг рдЯреА-20 рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдордзреНрдпреЗ рдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдХреЛрдгрддреНрдпрд╛рд╣реА рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрдерд┐рддреАрдд рдиреНрдпрд╛рдп рджреЗрддрд╛ рдпреЗрд╡реВ рд╢рдХрддреЛ. рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрдЪреЗ рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░рдкрдж рд░реЛрд╡реНрд╣рдорди рдкреЙрд╡реЗрд▓рдХрдбреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдХрд╕реЛрдЯреА рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдПрдХрджрд┐рд╡рд╕реАрдп рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЧрдорд╛рд╡рд▓реЗрд▓рд╛ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрдЪрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШ рдЯреА-20 рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрдд рдкреБрдирд░рд╛рдЧрдорди рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЗрд░рд╛рджреНрдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдореИрджрд╛рдирд╛рдд рдЙрддрд░рдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрддреАрд▓ рд╢реЗрд╡рдЯрдЪрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛рд╣реА рдпрд╛рдЪ рдореИрджрд╛рдирд╛рд╡рд░ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЧреЗрд▓рд╛. рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреАрдЪрд╛ рдЕрд╣рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдЖрддреНрддрд╛рдкрд░реНрдпрдВрдд 2022 рдордзреНрдпреЗ рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рдд рдмреНрд░рд╛рдпрди рд▓рд╛рд░рд╛ рд╕реНрдЯреЗрдбрд┐рдпрдорд╡рд░ рдлрдХреНрдд рдПрдХ рдЯреА-20 рдЖрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЧреЗрд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдЬрдп рдЭрд╛рд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдкреНрд░рдердо рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬреА рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рдиреЗ рдпрд╛ рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреАрд╡рд░ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдгрд╛рд░рд╛ рдПрдХрдореЗрд╡ рдЯреА-20 рдЖрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдЬрд┐рдВрдХрд▓рд╛. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╡реЗрд│реА, рдпрд╛рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реА рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЭрд╛рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдПрдХрджрд┐рд╡рд╕реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдкреНрд░рдердо рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬреА рдХрд░рддрд╛рдирд╛ рджрдгрджрдгреАрдд рд╡рд┐рдЬрдп рдорд┐рд│рд╡рд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреА рд╕реБрд░реБрд╡рд╛рддреАрд▓рд╛ рд╡реЗрдЧрд╡рд╛рди рдЧреЛрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬрд╛рдВрд╕рд╛рдареА рдЙрдкрдпреБрдХреНрдд рдард░рддреЗ. рдпрд╛рдирдВрддрд░ рдЬрд╕рдЬрд╕рд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдкреБрдвреЗ рд╕рд░рдХрддреЛ рддрд╕рддрд╢реА рдлрд┐рд░рдХреАрдкрдЯреВрдВрдирд╛ рдорджрдд рдорд┐рд│реВ рд▓рд╛рдЧрддреЗ. рджреЛрдиреНрд╣реА рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рдВрдЪреА рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╡реНрдп рдкреНрд▓реЗрдЗрдВрдЧ рдЗрд▓реЗрд╡реНрд╣рди: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛: рд╢реБрднрдорди рдЧрд┐рд▓, рдИрд╢рд╛рди рдХрд┐рд╢рди/рдпрд╢рд╕реНрд╡реА рдЬреИрд╕реНрд╡рд╛рд▓, рд╕реВрд░реНрдпрдХреБрдорд╛рд░ рдпрд╛рджрд╡, рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛, рд╕рдВрдЬреВ рд╕реЕрдорд╕рди, рдЕрдХреНрд╖рд░ рдкрдЯреЗрд▓, рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрдЧ, рдЖрд╡реЗрд╢ рдЦрд╛рди, рдХреБрд▓рджреАрдк рдпрд╛рджрд╡, рдореБрдХреЗрд╢ рдХреБрдорд╛рд░, рд░рд╡реА рдмрд┐рд╢реНрдиреЛрдИ. рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ: рдмреНрд░рдБрдбрди рдХрд┐рдВрдЧ, рдЬреЙрдиреНрд╕рди рдЪрд╛рд░реНрд▓реНрд╕, рд░реЛрд╡реНрд╣рдорди рдкреЙрд╡реЗрд▓ (рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░), рдирд┐рдХреЛрд▓рд╕ рдкреВрд░рди (рд╡рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдХреАрдкрд░), рд╢рд┐рдорд░реЙрди рд╣реЗрдЯрдорд╛рдпрд░, рдЬреЗрд╕рди рд╣реЛрд▓реНрдбрд░, рдХрд╛рдЗрд▓ рдореЗрдпрд░, рдУрдбрд┐рди рд╕реНрдорд┐рде, рд░реЛрдореЕрд░рд┐рдпреЛ рд╢реЗрдлрд░реНрдб, рдЕрдХреАрд▓ рд╣реЛрд╕реЗрди, рдЕрд▓реНрдЭрд╛рд░реА рдЬреЛрд╕реЗрдл.

newsArray.title: Virat Kohli Thanks Global Air Charter Services After They Arranged Special Return Flight For Him From West Indies to India (See Post)
newsArray.description: On his way back to India from West Indies, Virat Kohli gets arranged a special flight by the Global Air Charter Services.
newsArray.content: Virat Kohli's tour of West Indies with Team India is over as the ODI series has now come to an end. He is rested for the upcoming T20 series between India and West Indies and so he bids goodbye to Carribean islands and gets along on his way back to India. Global Air Charter Services arranged a special chartered flight for from West Indies to India. After enjoying their services, the star Indian cricketer shared an Instagram post thanking them for their services. Virat Kohli Comes On As Substitute Fielder During IND vs WI 3rd ODI 2023. Virat Kohli Thanks Global Air Charter Services A post shared by Virat Kohli (@virat.kohli) (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. The views and facts appearing in the social media post do not reflect the opinions of LatestLY, also LatestLY does not assume any responsibility or liability for the same.)

newsArray.title: World Championships 2023: Four Indian Javelin Throwers Qualify, One Set to Miss Out Due to Injury
newsArray.description: In a rare instance in Indian athletics, four men's javelin throwers from the country have qualified for the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, later this month, but injury to one member of the quartet meant that all of them will not take part in the big-ticket event.
newsArray.content: New Delhi, August 2 : In a rare instance in Indian athletics, four men's javelin throwers from the country have qualified for the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, later this month, but injury to one member of the quartet meant that all of them will not take part in the big-ticket event. Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has already qualified for the August 19-27 showpiece as wild card by virtue of being the Diamond League champion and Kishore Jena also made the cut in the world ranking quota. IND vs WI Dream11 Team Prediction, 1st T20I 2023: Tips To Pick Best Fantasy Playing XI for India vs West Indies Cricket Match in Trinidad. Rohit Yadav and DP Manu also made it to the 36 javelin throwers' list to compete in the world championships. But Rohit had recently undergone a surgery on his throwing elbow and he will miss the World Championships. World Athletics (WA) on Wednesday updated its Road to Budapest list after the qualification period ended on July 30. Jena, who won gold in the Sri Lankan National Championships on July 30 with a personal best of 84.38m, took the 36th spot. A country can have three athletes in each event but the number can be increased to four if one makes the cut through wild card. In India's case, Chopra qualified as wild card and so the country can have another three javelin throwers if they qualify. But it is up to the Athletics Federation of India (AFI) to decide the Indian team and it may not send a particular player to compete in an event. Qualification can be achieved through breaching entry standard as well and through world ranking quota and WA has earmarked specific numbers for each head. The men's 20km race walk event also has three Indians in Akshdeep Singh, Vikash Singh and Paramjeet Bisht qualifying through entry standard. In women's 20km race walk, Priyanka Goswami has qualified by breaching the entry standard, while Bhawna Jat made the cut in world ranking quota. In men's triple jump, three Indians -- Praveen Chithravel, Abdulla Aboobacker and Eldhose Paul -- have made the cut. Chithravel breached the entry standard, while Aboobacker and Paul qualified through world ranking quota. India's newest Diamond League medallist, long jumper Murali Sreeshankar and ace 3000m steeplechaser Avinash Sable have already qualified through entry standard. Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul Unlikely to Be Selected in the Indian Cricket Team Squad For Asia Cup 2023: Report. Jeswin Aldrin has also qualified in men's long jump through breaching entry standard. Asian record holder shot putter Tajinderpal Toor also qualified via entry standard. Jyothi Yarraji and Parul Chaudhary have qualified in women's 100m hurdle and 3000m steeplechase respectively as Asian champions. Long jumper Shali Singh and javelin thrower Annu Rani also made the cut in the world ranking quota. Kishan Kumar (800m), Ajay Kuar Saroj (1500m), Sarvesh Anil Kushare and Tejaswin Shankar (high jump) and Ram Baboo (men's 35km race walk) also qualified in the world ranking quota, so as Santhosh Kumar (men's 400m hurdles) and K M Chanda (women's 800m). In the relay events, only the men's 4x400m team made the cut.

newsArray.title: KL Rahul Likely to Miss Asia Cup, Shreyas Iyer Uncertain for ICC World Cup 2023
newsArray.description: Senior batter KL Rahul in all likelihood will miss the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka as he will take more time to recover from his hamstring injury while it could be a touch and go for another star Shreyas Iyer as far as his participation in the World Cup is concerned.
newsArray.content: New Delhi, August 2 : Senior batter KL Rahul in all likelihood will miss the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka as he will take more time to recover from his hamstring injury while it could be a touch and go for another star Shreyas Iyer as far as his participation in the World Cup is concerned. Rahul had undergone a thigh surgery while Iyer had a surgery on his lower back to cure stress fracture. IND vs WI Dream11 Team Prediction, 1st T20I 2023: Tips To Pick Best Fantasy Playing XI for India vs West Indies Cricket Match in Trinidad. The last BCCI update didn't specify their date of return of the duo as they were seen slowly building on their workload as far as 'Return to Play' is concerned. "It is unlikely that both Rahul and Shreyas would be match fit for 50-over cricket and that too in humid conditions in Sri Lanka. But BCCI medical team feels that Rahul can at least get fit before the three-match series against Australia before the World Cup," a BCCI source told PTI on conditions of anonymity. "In case of Iyer, he has also started skills training but World Cup for him will be touch and go if Indian management thinks of putting a 100 percent fit Iyer back on the park. T20 is an easier vehicle for comeback unlike 50-over cricket. We are keeping fingers crossed," the source added. Rahul has already started his keeping drills. But keeping for 50 overs with recovering hamstring will be a bit too much, considering India's Asia Cup campaign starts early next month. Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul Unlikely to Be Selected in the Indian Cricket Team Squad For Asia Cup 2023: Report. Rahul's fitness is very important in larger context as he will also bat at No.5 and is expected to play a big role in the middle overs. The Indian team management is desperate to have at least one of the two fit and available for the World Cup. PTI KHS

newsArray.title: Ishan KishanтАЩs Co-Incidental Response to Aakash ChopraтАЩs тАШYouтАЩre Not DhoniтАЩ Comment During IND vs WI ODI Series 2023 Goes Viral (Watch Video)
newsArray.description: Ishan Kishan was named Player of the Series for his three half-centuries in all three ODIs. The video of this moment has gone viral on social media after Aakash Chopra himself shared it, writing, "We love you Ishan."
newsArray.content: Ishan Kishan's co-incidental response to Aakash Chopra has gone viral after the former cricketer-turned-commentator said that the youngster was not Dhoni. This happened during the recently concluded ODI series between India and West Indies during which Kishan, keeping wickets, had appealed for a stumping. The batter's feet was firmly grounded and Chopra on air, said, "It's very rare that you review the stumping and run out dismissal. So far, I am seeing the feet on the ground. You can come from Ranchi, but your name is not MS Dhoni." Co-incidentally, Kishan was heard saying, ' Ha, fir thik hai ," on the stump mic. Chopra who later shared the video, then went on to say, "We love you Ishan." Ravichandran Ashwin Defends Team Management's Decision to Rest Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma During India vs West Indies ODI Series 2023 . Watch Video Here We love you, Ishan ЁЯдЧ @JioCinema #WIvsIND #CricketTwitter pic.twitter.com/UnzHz1pth1 тАФ Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) August 1, 2023 (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. newsArray.content: IND vs WI 1st T20 2023: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдиреЗ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрд╡рд┐рд░реБрджреНрдзрдЪреА рддреАрди рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ 2-1 рдиреЗ рдЬрд┐рдВрдХрд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рд╡реЗрд│реА, рдЖрддрд╛ рджреЛрдиреНрд╣реА рд╕рдВрдШ рдЯреА-20 рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрдд рдПрдХрдореЗрдХрд╛рдВрд╢реА рднрд┐рдбрдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗрдд. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рддреАрд▓ 3 рдЯреА-20 рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреА рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЖрдЬрдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рдореНрд╣рдгрдЬреЗрдЪ 3 рдСрдЧрд╕реНрдЯрдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рдЦреЗрд│рд╡рд▓реА рдЬрд╛рдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪреА рдХрдорд╛рди рдЕрдиреБрднрд╡реА рдЕрд╖реНрдЯрдкреИрд▓реВ рдЦреЗрд│рд╛рдбреВ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрд╛рдВрдбреНрдпрд╛рдХрдбреЗ (Hardik Pandya) рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдирд┐рдпрдорд┐рдд рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░ рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ (Rohit Sharma) рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╕реНрдЯрд╛рд░ рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬ рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реАрд▓рд╛ (Virat Kohli) рд╡рд┐рд╢реНрд░рд╛рдВрддреА рджреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЖрд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ. (рд╣реЗ рджреЗрдЦреАрд▓ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╛: IND vs WI 1st T20 2023: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЛрдард╛ рдкрд░рд╛рдХреНрд░рдо рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рдареА рд╕рдЬреНрдЬ, рдЖрдЬрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рджреНрд╡рд╛рд░реЗ рдЯреА-20 рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдордзреАрд▓ рдПрдХ рдЦрд╛рд╕ рджреНрд╡рд┐рд╢рддрдХ рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд░ рдкреВрд░реНрдг ) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬрдЪрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШ рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рд╡рд╛рдИрдЯ рджреМрд▒реНрдпрд╛рддреВрди рдЬрд╛рдд рдЖрд╣реЗ рдкрдг рдЯреА-20 рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдордзреНрдпреЗ рдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдХреЛрдгрддреНрдпрд╛рд╣реА рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрдерд┐рддреАрдд рдиреНрдпрд╛рдп рджреЗрддрд╛ рдпреЗрд╡реВ рд╢рдХрддреЛ. рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрдЪреЗ рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░рдкрдж рд░реЛрд╡реНрд╣рдорди рдкреЙрд╡реЗрд▓рдХрдбреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдХрд╕реЛрдЯреА рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдПрдХрджрд┐рд╡рд╕реАрдп рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЧрдорд╛рд╡рд▓реЗрд▓рд╛ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрдЪрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШ рдЯреА-20 рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрдд рдкреБрдирд░рд╛рдЧрдорди рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЗрд░рд╛рджреНрдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдореИрджрд╛рдирд╛рдд рдЙрддрд░рдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрддреАрд▓ рд╢реЗрд╡рдЯрдЪрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛рд╣реА рдпрд╛рдЪ рдореИрджрд╛рдирд╛рд╡рд░ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЧреЗрд▓рд╛. рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреАрдЪрд╛ рдЕрд╣рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдЖрддреНрддрд╛рдкрд░реНрдпрдВрдд 2022 рдордзреНрдпреЗ рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рдд рдмреНрд░рд╛рдпрди рд▓рд╛рд░рд╛ рд╕реНрдЯреЗрдбрд┐рдпрдорд╡рд░ рдлрдХреНрдд рдПрдХ рдЯреА-20 рдЖрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЧреЗрд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдЬрдп рдЭрд╛рд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдкреНрд░рдердо рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬреА рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рдиреЗ рдпрд╛ рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреАрд╡рд░ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдгрд╛рд░рд╛ рдПрдХрдореЗрд╡ рдЯреА-20 рдЖрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдЬрд┐рдВрдХрд▓рд╛. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╡реЗрд│реА, рдпрд╛рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реА рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЭрд╛рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдПрдХрджрд┐рд╡рд╕реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдкреНрд░рдердо рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬреА рдХрд░рддрд╛рдирд╛ рджрдгрджрдгреАрдд рд╡рд┐рдЬрдп рдорд┐рд│рд╡рд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреА рд╕реБрд░реБрд╡рд╛рддреАрд▓рд╛ рд╡реЗрдЧрд╡рд╛рди рдЧреЛрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬрд╛рдВрд╕рд╛рдареА рдЙрдкрдпреБрдХреНрдд рдард░рддреЗ. рдпрд╛рдирдВрддрд░ рдЬрд╕рдЬрд╕рд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдкреБрдвреЗ рд╕рд░рдХрддреЛ рддрд╕рддрд╢реА рдлрд┐рд░рдХреАрдкрдЯреВрдВрдирд╛ рдорджрдд рдорд┐рд│реВ рд▓рд╛рдЧрддреЗ. рджреЛрдиреНрд╣реА рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рдВрдЪреА рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╡реНрдп рдкреНрд▓реЗрдЗрдВрдЧ рдЗрд▓реЗрд╡реНрд╣рди: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛: рд╢реБрднрдорди рдЧрд┐рд▓, рдИрд╢рд╛рди рдХрд┐рд╢рди/рдпрд╢рд╕реНрд╡реА рдЬреИрд╕реНрд╡рд╛рд▓, рд╕реВрд░реНрдпрдХреБрдорд╛рд░ рдпрд╛рджрд╡, рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛, рд╕рдВрдЬреВ рд╕реЕрдорд╕рди, рдЕрдХреНрд╖рд░ рдкрдЯреЗрд▓, рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрдЧ, рдЖрд╡реЗрд╢ рдЦрд╛рди, рдХреБрд▓рджреАрдк рдпрд╛рджрд╡, рдореБрдХреЗрд╢ рдХреБрдорд╛рд░, рд░рд╡реА рдмрд┐рд╢реНрдиреЛрдИ. рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ: рдмреНрд░рдБрдбрди рдХрд┐рдВрдЧ, рдЬреЙрдиреНрд╕рди рдЪрд╛рд░реНрд▓реНрд╕, рд░реЛрд╡реНрд╣рдорди рдкреЙрд╡реЗрд▓ (рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░), рдирд┐рдХреЛрд▓рд╕ рдкреВрд░рди (рд╡рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдХреАрдкрд░), рд╢рд┐рдорд░реЙрди рд╣реЗрдЯрдорд╛рдпрд░, рдЬреЗрд╕рди рд╣реЛрд▓реНрдбрд░, рдХрд╛рдЗрд▓ рдореЗрдпрд░, рдУрдбрд┐рди рд╕реНрдорд┐рде, рд░реЛрдореЕрд░рд┐рдпреЛ рд╢реЗрдлрд░реНрдб, рдЕрдХреАрд▓ рд╣реЛрд╕реЗрди, рдЕрд▓реНрдЭрд╛рд░реА рдЬреЛрд╕реЗрдл.

newsArray.title: Virat Kohli Thanks Global Air Charter Services After They Arranged Special Return Flight For Him From West Indies to India (See Post)
newsArray.description: On his way back to India from West Indies, Virat Kohli gets arranged a special flight by the Global Air Charter Services.
newsArray.content: Virat Kohli's tour of West Indies with Team India is over as the ODI series has now come to an end. He is rested for the upcoming T20 series between India and West Indies and so he bids goodbye to Carribean islands and gets along on his way back to India. Global Air Charter Services arranged a special chartered flight for from West Indies to India. After enjoying their services, the star Indian cricketer shared an Instagram post thanking them for their services. Virat Kohli Comes On As Substitute Fielder During IND vs WI 3rd ODI 2023. Virat Kohli Thanks Global Air Charter Services A post shared by Virat Kohli (@virat.kohli) (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. The views and facts appearing in the social media post do not reflect the opinions of LatestLY, also LatestLY does not assume any responsibility or liability for the same.)

newsArray.title: World Championships 2023: Four Indian Javelin Throwers Qualify, One Set to Miss Out Due to Injury
newsArray.description: In a rare instance in Indian athletics, four men's javelin throwers from the country have qualified for the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, later this month, but injury to one member of the quartet meant that all of them will not take part in the big-ticket event.
newsArray.content: New Delhi, August 2 : In a rare instance in Indian athletics, four men's javelin throwers from the country have qualified for the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, later this month, but injury to one member of the quartet meant that all of them will not take part in the big-ticket event. Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has already qualified for the August 19-27 showpiece as wild card by virtue of being the Diamond League champion and Kishore Jena also made the cut in the world ranking quota. IND vs WI Dream11 Team Prediction, 1st T20I 2023: Tips To Pick Best Fantasy Playing XI for India vs West Indies Cricket Match in Trinidad. Rohit Yadav and DP Manu also made it to the 36 javelin throwers' list to compete in the world championships. But Rohit had recently undergone a surgery on his throwing elbow and he will miss the World Championships. World Athletics (WA) on Wednesday updated its Road to Budapest list after the qualification period ended on July 30. Jena, who won gold in the Sri Lankan National Championships on July 30 with a personal best of 84.38m, took the 36th spot. A country can have three athletes in each event but the number can be increased to four if one makes the cut through wild card. In India's case, Chopra qualified as wild card and so the country can have another three javelin throwers if they qualify. But it is up to the Athletics Federation of India (AFI) to decide the Indian team and it may not send a particular player to compete in an event. Qualification can be achieved through breaching entry standard as well and through world ranking quota and WA has earmarked specific numbers for each head. The men's 20km race walk event also has three Indians in Akshdeep Singh, Vikash Singh and Paramjeet Bisht qualifying through entry standard. In women's 20km race walk, Priyanka Goswami has qualified by breaching the entry standard, while Bhawna Jat made the cut in world ranking quota. In men's triple jump, three Indians -- Praveen Chithravel, Abdulla Aboobacker and Eldhose Paul -- have made the cut. Chithravel breached the entry standard, while Aboobacker and Paul qualified through world ranking quota. India's newest Diamond League medallist, long jumper Murali Sreeshankar and ace 3000m steeplechaser Avinash Sable have already qualified through entry standard. Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul Unlikely to Be Selected in the Indian Cricket Team Squad For Asia Cup 2023: Report. Jeswin Aldrin has also qualified in men's long jump through breaching entry standard. Asian record holder shot putter Tajinderpal Toor also qualified via entry standard. Jyothi Yarraji and Parul Chaudhary have qualified in women's 100m hurdle and 3000m steeplechase respectively as Asian champions. Long jumper Shali Singh and javelin thrower Annu Rani also made the cut in the world ranking quota. Kishan Kumar (800m), Ajay Kuar Saroj (1500m), Sarvesh Anil Kushare and Tejaswin Shankar (high jump) and Ram Baboo (men's 35km race walk) also qualified in the world ranking quota, so as Santhosh Kumar (men's 400m hurdles) and K M Chanda (women's 800m). In the relay events, only the men's 4x400m team made the cut.

newsArray.title: KL Rahul Likely to Miss Asia Cup, Shreyas Iyer Uncertain for ICC World Cup 2023
newsArray.description: Senior batter KL Rahul in all likelihood will miss the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka as he will take more time to recover from his hamstring injury while it could be a touch and go for another star Shreyas Iyer as far as his participation in the World Cup is concerned.
newsArray.content: New Delhi, August 2 : Senior batter KL Rahul in all likelihood will miss the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka as he will take more time to recover from his hamstring injury while it could be a touch and go for another star Shreyas Iyer as far as his participation in the World Cup is concerned. Rahul had undergone a thigh surgery while Iyer had a surgery on his lower back to cure stress fracture. IND vs WI Dream11 Team Prediction, 1st T20I 2023: Tips To Pick Best Fantasy Playing XI for India vs West Indies Cricket Match in Trinidad. The last BCCI update didn't specify their date of return of the duo as they were seen slowly building on their workload as far as 'Return to Play' is concerned. "It is unlikely that both Rahul and Shreyas would be match fit for 50-over cricket and that too in humid conditions in Sri Lanka. But BCCI medical team feels that Rahul can at least get fit before the three-match series against Australia before the World Cup," a BCCI source told PTI on conditions of anonymity. "In case of Iyer, he has also started skills training but World Cup for him will be touch and go if Indian management thinks of putting a 100 percent fit Iyer back on the park. T20 is an easier vehicle for comeback unlike 50-over cricket. We are keeping fingers crossed," the source added. Rahul has already started his keeping drills. But keeping for 50 overs with recovering hamstring will be a bit too much, considering India's Asia Cup campaign starts early next month. Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul Unlikely to Be Selected in the Indian Cricket Team Squad For Asia Cup 2023: Report. Rahul's fitness is very important in larger context as he will also bat at No.5 and is expected to play a big role in the middle overs. The Indian team management is desperate to have at least one of the two fit and available for the World Cup. PTI KHS

newsArray.title: Ishan KishanтАЩs Co-Incidental Response to Aakash ChopraтАЩs тАШYouтАЩre Not DhoniтАЩ Comment During IND vs WI ODI Series 2023 Goes Viral (Watch Video)
newsArray.description: Ishan Kishan was named Player of the Series for his three half-centuries in all three ODIs. The video of this moment has gone viral on social media after Aakash Chopra himself shared it, writing, "We love you Ishan."
newsArray.content: Ishan Kishan's co-incidental response to Aakash Chopra has gone viral after the former cricketer-turned-commentator said that the youngster was not Dhoni. This happened during the recently concluded ODI series between India and West Indies during which Kishan, keeping wickets, had appealed for a stumping. The batter's feet was firmly grounded and Chopra on air, said, "It's very rare that you review the stumping and run out dismissal. So far, I am seeing the feet on the ground. You can come from Ranchi, but your name is not MS Dhoni." Co-incidentally, Kishan was heard saying, ' Ha, fir thik hai ," on the stump mic. Chopra who later shared the video, then went on to say, "We love you Ishan." Ravichandran Ashwin Defends Team Management's Decision to Rest Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma During India vs West Indies ODI Series 2023 . Watch Video Here We love you, Ishan ЁЯдЧ @JioCinema #WIvsIND #CricketTwitter pic.twitter.com/UnzHz1pth1 тАФ Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) August 1, 2023 (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. newsArray.content: IND vs WI 1st T20 2023: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдиреЗ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрд╡рд┐рд░реБрджреНрдзрдЪреА рддреАрди рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ 2-1 рдиреЗ рдЬрд┐рдВрдХрд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪ рд╡реЗрд│реА, рдЖрддрд╛ рджреЛрдиреНрд╣реА рд╕рдВрдШ рдЯреА-20 рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрдд рдПрдХрдореЗрдХрд╛рдВрд╢реА рднрд┐рдбрдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗрдд. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рддреАрд▓ 3 рдЯреА-20 рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдВрдЪреА рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЖрдЬрдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рдореНрд╣рдгрдЬреЗрдЪ 3 рдСрдЧрд╕реНрдЯрдкрд╛рд╕реВрди рдЦреЗрд│рд╡рд▓реА рдЬрд╛рдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪреА рдХрдорд╛рди рдЕрдиреБрднрд╡реА рдЕрд╖реНрдЯрдкреИрд▓реВ рдЦреЗрд│рд╛рдбреВ рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрд╛рдВрдбреНрдпрд╛рдХрдбреЗ (Hardik Pandya) рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдирд┐рдпрдорд┐рдд рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░ рд░реЛрд╣рд┐рдд рд╢рд░реНрдорд╛ (Rohit Sharma) рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╕реНрдЯрд╛рд░ рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬ рд╡рд┐рд░рд╛рдЯ рдХреЛрд╣рд▓реАрд▓рд╛ (Virat Kohli) рд╡рд┐рд╢реНрд░рд╛рдВрддреА рджреЗрдгреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЖрд▓реА рдЖрд╣реЗ. (рд╣реЗ рджреЗрдЦреАрд▓ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╛: IND vs WI 1st T20 2023: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдореЛрдард╛ рдкрд░рд╛рдХреНрд░рдо рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рд╕рд╛рдареА рд╕рдЬреНрдЬ, рдЖрдЬрдЪреНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рджреНрд╡рд╛рд░реЗ рдЯреА-20 рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдордзреАрд▓ рдПрдХ рдЦрд╛рд╕ рджреНрд╡рд┐рд╢рддрдХ рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд░ рдкреВрд░реНрдг ) рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рд╡рд┐рдВрдбреАрдЬрдЪрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШ рдЖрдкрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рд░реНрд╡рд╛рдд рд╡рд╛рдИрдЯ рджреМрд▒реНрдпрд╛рддреВрди рдЬрд╛рдд рдЖрд╣реЗ рдкрдг рдЯреА-20 рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдордзреНрдпреЗ рдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдХреЛрдгрддреНрдпрд╛рд╣реА рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрдерд┐рддреАрдд рдиреНрдпрд╛рдп рджреЗрддрд╛ рдпреЗрд╡реВ рд╢рдХрддреЛ. рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрдЪреЗ рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░рдкрдж рд░реЛрд╡реНрд╣рдорди рдкреЙрд╡реЗрд▓рдХрдбреЗ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рдХрд╕реЛрдЯреА рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рдПрдХрджрд┐рд╡рд╕реАрдп рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХрд╛ рдЧрдорд╛рд╡рд▓реЗрд▓рд╛ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬрдЪрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШ рдЯреА-20 рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрдд рдкреБрдирд░рд╛рдЧрдорди рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪреНрдпрд╛ рдЗрд░рд╛рджреНрдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдореИрджрд╛рдирд╛рдд рдЙрддрд░рдгрд╛рд░ рдЖрд╣реЗ. рд╡рдирдбреЗ рдорд╛рд▓рд┐рдХреЗрддреАрд▓ рд╢реЗрд╡рдЯрдЪрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛рд╣реА рдпрд╛рдЪ рдореИрджрд╛рдирд╛рд╡рд░ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЧреЗрд▓рд╛. рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреАрдЪрд╛ рдЕрд╣рд╡рд╛рд▓ рдЖрддреНрддрд╛рдкрд░реНрдпрдВрдд 2022 рдордзреНрдпреЗ рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рдд рдмреНрд░рд╛рдпрди рд▓рд╛рд░рд╛ рд╕реНрдЯреЗрдбрд┐рдпрдорд╡рд░ рдлрдХреНрдд рдПрдХ рдЯреА-20 рдЖрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЧреЗрд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдпрд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдЬрдп рдЭрд╛рд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдкреНрд░рдердо рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬреА рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд▒реНрдпрд╛ рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рдиреЗ рдпрд╛ рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреАрд╡рд░ рдЦреЗрд│рд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдгрд╛рд░рд╛ рдПрдХрдореЗрд╡ рдЯреА-20 рдЖрдВрддрд░рд░рд╛рд╖реНрдЯреНрд░реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдЬрд┐рдВрдХрд▓рд╛. рддреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╡реЗрд│реА, рдпрд╛рдкреВрд░реНрд╡реА рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдЬ рдпрд╛рдВрдЪреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЭрд╛рд▓реЗрд▓реНрдпрд╛ рдПрдХрджрд┐рд╡рд╕реАрдп рд╕рд╛рдордиреНрдпрд╛рдд рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛рдиреЗ рдкреНрд░рдердо рдлрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬреА рдХрд░рддрд╛рдирд╛ рджрдгрджрдгреАрдд рд╡рд┐рдЬрдп рдорд┐рд│рд╡рд▓рд╛ рд╣реЛрддрд╛. рдЦреЗрд│рдкрдЯреНрдЯреА рд╕реБрд░реБрд╡рд╛рддреАрд▓рд╛ рд╡реЗрдЧрд╡рд╛рди рдЧреЛрд▓рдВрджрд╛рдЬрд╛рдВрд╕рд╛рдареА рдЙрдкрдпреБрдХреНрдд рдард░рддреЗ. рдпрд╛рдирдВрддрд░ рдЬрд╕рдЬрд╕рд╛ рд╕рд╛рдордирд╛ рдкреБрдвреЗ рд╕рд░рдХрддреЛ рддрд╕рддрд╢реА рдлрд┐рд░рдХреАрдкрдЯреВрдВрдирд╛ рдорджрдд рдорд┐рд│реВ рд▓рд╛рдЧрддреЗ. рджреЛрдиреНрд╣реА рд╕рдВрдШрд╛рдВрдЪреА рд╕рдВрднрд╛рд╡реНрдп рдкреНрд▓реЗрдЗрдВрдЧ рдЗрд▓реЗрд╡реНрд╣рди: рдЯреАрдо рдЗрдВрдбрд┐рдпрд╛: рд╢реБрднрдорди рдЧрд┐рд▓, рдИрд╢рд╛рди рдХрд┐рд╢рди/рдпрд╢рд╕реНрд╡реА рдЬреИрд╕реНрд╡рд╛рд▓, рд╕реВрд░реНрдпрдХреБрдорд╛рд░ рдпрд╛рджрд╡, рд╣рд╛рд░реНрджрд┐рдХ рдкрдВрдбреНрдпрд╛, рд╕рдВрдЬреВ рд╕реЕрдорд╕рди, рдЕрдХреНрд╖рд░ рдкрдЯреЗрд▓, рдЕрд░реНрд╢рджреАрдк рд╕рд┐рдВрдЧ, рдЖрд╡реЗрд╢ рдЦрд╛рди, рдХреБрд▓рджреАрдк рдпрд╛рджрд╡, рдореБрдХреЗрд╢ рдХреБрдорд╛рд░, рд░рд╡реА рдмрд┐рд╢реНрдиреЛрдИ. рд╡реЗрд╕реНрдЯ рдЗрдВрдбреАрдЬ: рдмреНрд░рдБрдбрди рдХрд┐рдВрдЧ, рдЬреЙрдиреНрд╕рди рдЪрд╛рд░реНрд▓реНрд╕, рд░реЛрд╡реНрд╣рдорди рдкреЙрд╡реЗрд▓ (рдХрд░реНрдгрдзрд╛рд░), рдирд┐рдХреЛрд▓рд╕ рдкреВрд░рди (рд╡рд┐рдХреЗрдЯрдХреАрдкрд░), рд╢рд┐рдорд░реЙрди рд╣реЗрдЯрдорд╛рдпрд░, рдЬреЗрд╕рди рд╣реЛрд▓реНрдбрд░, рдХрд╛рдЗрд▓ рдореЗрдпрд░, рдУрдбрд┐рди рд╕реНрдорд┐рде, рд░реЛрдореЕрд░рд┐рдпреЛ рд╢реЗрдлрд░реНрдб, рдЕрдХреАрд▓ рд╣реЛрд╕реЗрди, рдЕрд▓реНрдЭрд╛рд░реА рдЬреЛрд╕реЗрдл.

newsArray.title: Virat Kohli Thanks Global Air Charter Services After They Arranged Special Return Flight For Him From West Indies to India (See Post)
newsArray.description: On his way back to India from West Indies, Virat Kohli gets arranged a special flight by the Global Air Charter Services.
newsArray.content: Virat Kohli's tour of West Indies with Team India is over as the ODI series has now come to an end. He is rested for the upcoming T20 series between India and West Indies and so he bids goodbye to Carribean islands and gets along on his way back to India. Global Air Charter Services arranged a special chartered flight for from West Indies to India. After enjoying their services, the star Indian cricketer shared an Instagram post thanking them for their services. Virat Kohli Comes On As Substitute Fielder During IND vs WI 3rd ODI 2023. Virat Kohli Thanks Global Air Charter Services A post shared by Virat Kohli (@virat.kohli) (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. The above post is embeded directly from the user's social media account and LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body. The views and facts appearing in the social media post do not reflect the opinions of LatestLY, also LatestLY does not assume any responsibility or liability for the same.)

newsArray.title: World Championships 2023: Four Indian Javelin Throwers Qualify, One Set to Miss Out Due to Injury
newsArray.description: In a rare instance in Indian athletics, four men's javelin throwers from the country have qualified for the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, later this month, but injury to one member of the quartet meant that all of them will not take part in the big-ticket event.
newsArray.content: New Delhi, August 2 : In a rare instance in Indian athletics, four men's javelin throwers from the country have qualified for the World Championships in Budapest, Hungary, later this month, but injury to one member of the quartet meant that all of them will not take part in the big-ticket event. Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has already qualified for the August 19-27 showpiece as wild card by virtue of being the Diamond League champion and Kishore Jena also made the cut in the world ranking quota. IND vs WI Dream11 Team Prediction, 1st T20I 2023: Tips To Pick Best Fantasy Playing XI for India vs West Indies Cricket Match in Trinidad. Rohit Yadav and DP Manu also made it to the 36 javelin throwers' list to compete in the world championships. But Rohit had recently undergone a surgery on his throwing elbow and he will miss the World Championships. World Athletics (WA) on Wednesday updated its Road to Budapest list after the qualification period ended on July 30. Jena, who won gold in the Sri Lankan National Championships on July 30 with a personal best of 84.38m, took the 36th spot. A country can have three athletes in each event but the number can be increased to four if one makes the cut through wild card. In India's case, Chopra qualified as wild card and so the country can have another three javelin throwers if they qualify. But it is up to the Athletics Federation of India (AFI) to decide the Indian team and it may not send a particular player to compete in an event. Qualification can be achieved through breaching entry standard as well and through world ranking quota and WA has earmarked specific numbers for each head. The men's 20km race walk event also has three Indians in Akshdeep Singh, Vikash Singh and Paramjeet Bisht qualifying through entry standard. In women's 20km race walk, Priyanka Goswami has qualified by breaching the entry standard, while Bhawna Jat made the cut in world ranking quota. In men's triple jump, three Indians -- Praveen Chithravel, Abdulla Aboobacker and Eldhose Paul -- have made the cut. Chithravel breached the entry standard, while Aboobacker and Paul qualified through world ranking quota. India's newest Diamond League medallist, long jumper Murali Sreeshankar and ace 3000m steeplechaser Avinash Sable have already qualified through entry standard. Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul Unlikely to Be Selected in the Indian Cricket Team Squad For Asia Cup 2023: Report. Jeswin Aldrin has also qualified in men's long jump through breaching entry standard. Asian record holder shot putter Tajinderpal Toor also qualified via entry standard. Jyothi Yarraji and Parul Chaudhary have qualified in women's 100m hurdle and 3000m steeplechase respectively as Asian champions. Long jumper Shali Singh and javelin thrower Annu Rani also made the cut in the world ranking quota. Kishan Kumar (800m), Ajay Kuar Saroj (1500m), Sarvesh Anil Kushare and Tejaswin Shankar (high jump) and Ram Baboo (men's 35km race walk) also qualified in the world ranking quota, so as Santhosh Kumar (men's 400m hurdles) and K M Chanda (women's 800m). In the relay events, only the men's 4x400m team made the cut.

newsArray.title: KL Rahul Likely to Miss Asia Cup, Shreyas Iyer Uncertain for ICC World Cup 2023
newsArray.description: Senior batter KL Rahul in all likelihood will miss the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka as he will take more time to recover from his hamstring injury while it could be a touch and go for another star Shreyas Iyer as far as his participation in the World Cup is concerned.
newsArray.content: New Delhi, August 2 : Senior batter KL Rahul in all likelihood will miss the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka as he will take more time to recover from his hamstring injury while it could be a touch and go for another star Shreyas Iyer as far as his participation in the World Cup is concerned. Rahul had undergone a thigh surgery while Iyer had a surgery on his lower back to cure stress fracture. IND vs WI Dream11 Team Prediction, 1st T20I 2023: Tips To Pick Best Fantasy Playing XI for India vs West Indies Cricket Match in Trinidad. The last BCCI update didn't specify their date of return of the duo as they were seen slowly building on their workload as far as 'Return to Play' is concerned. "It is unlikely that both Rahul and Shreyas would be match fit for 50-over cricket and that too in humid conditions in Sri Lanka. But BCCI medical team feels that Rahul can at least get fit before the three-match series against Australia before the World Cup," a BCCI source told PTI on conditions of anonymity. "In case of Iyer, he has also started skills training but World Cup for him will be touch and go if Indian management thinks of putting a 100 percent fit Iyer back on the park. T20 is an easier vehicle for comeback unlike 50-over cricket. We are keeping fingers crossed," the source added. Rahul has already started his keeping drills. But keeping for 50 overs with recovering hamstring will be a bit too much, considering India's Asia Cup campaign starts early next month. Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul Unlikely to Be Selected in the Indian Cricket Team Squad For Asia Cup 2023: Report. Rahul's fitness is very important in larger context as he will also bat at No.5 and is expected to play a big role in the middle overs. The Indian team management is desperate to have at least one of the two fit and available for the World Cup. PTI KHS
